issue.title: fix: add windows to target_os of TaoWindowEvent::Focused (fix #9755)

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(windows): fix race condition in event loop
    - docs: update example for `App::show`
    - feat: add `Window::set_fullscreen`

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. If there is a related issue, reference it in the PR text, e.g. closes #123.
3. If this change requires a new version, then add a change file in `.changes` directory with the appropriate bump, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.changes/README.md
4. Ensure that all your commits are signed https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits
5. Ensure `cargo test` and `cargo clippy` passes.
6. Propose your changes as a draft PR if your work is still in progress.
-->

closes https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/9755

Fixed an issue where focus events would not fire when unstable feature was enabled in Windows.

issue.title: [bug] Tauri with unstable feature enabled doesn't trigger WindowEvent::Focused

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

labels.name: scope: unstable flag
labels.description: Issue only occures with "unstable" feature flag enabled

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When i enabled `features = ["unstable"]` unstable feature in my app (need it for multiwebview), i notice wrong behaviour in my popover window - its not hide on loosed focus.

### Reproduction

I also can reproduce this bug with the fresh project. 
`window event: Focused` never triggers until `unstable` feature removed.
```
cargo install create-tauri-app --locked
cargo create-tauri-app
```
```
[dependencies]
tauri = { version = "2", features = ["unstable"] }
```

```rs
pub fn run() {
    tauri::Builder::default()
        .plugin(tauri_plugin_opener::init())
        .invoke_handler(tauri::generate_handler![greet])
        .setup(|app| {
            let window = app.get_webview_window("main").unwrap();
            window.on_window_event(|event| {
                println!("window event: {:?}", event);
            });

            Ok(())
        })
        .run(tauri::generate_context!())
        .expect("error while running tauri application");
}

```

### Expected behavior

Expected `window event: Focused` output 

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
[âœ”] Environment
    - OS: Windows 10.0.26100 x86_64 (X64)
    âœ” WebView2: 132.0.2957.127
    âœ” MSVC: Visual Studio Community 2022

    âœ” Rust toolchain: nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc (default)
    - node: 23.6.0
    - npm: 10.8.3

[-] Packages
    - tauri ðŸ¦€: 2.2.5
    - tauri-build ðŸ¦€: 2.0.5
    - wry ðŸ¦€: 0.48.1
    - tao ðŸ¦€: 0.31.1
    - tauri-cli ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.7
    - @tauri-apps/api îœ˜: 2.2.0
    - @tauri-apps/cli îœ˜: 2.2.7

[-] Plugins
    - tauri-plugin-opener ðŸ¦€: 2.2.5
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-opener îœ˜: 2.2.5

[-] App
```

issue.title: [bug] onFocusChanged event stops firing when "unstable" feature is activated

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

`onFocusChanged` event stops firing for the `Window` when "unstable" feature is activated.

### Reproduction

1. I use Tauri + Angular template.
2. Activate "unstable" feature in Cargo.toml file:
```toml
[dependencies]
tauri = { version = "2", features = ["unstable"] }
```
3. Describe your window in tauri.conf.json file:
```json
"app": {
    "windows": [
      {
        "label": "paste-window",
        "url": "paste-window",
        "width": 400,
        "height": 400,
        "resizable": false,
        "decorations": false,
        "skipTaskbar": true,
        "alwaysOnTop": true,
        "visible": false
      }
    ],
    "security": {
      "csp": null
    }
  },
```
4. At some point get window by label, subscribe to the `onFocusChanged` event and show the window:
```typescript
const pasteWindow = await Window.getByLabel('paste-window');
await pasteWindow?.onFocusChanged(e => {
  console.log('this does not fire');
});
await pasteWindow?.show();
```
5. Click somewhere outside the window.
6. Notice the event does not fire.

### Expected behavior

The event must fire as it fires when "unstable" feature is not activated.

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
[âœ”] Environment
    - OS: Windows 10.0.22631 x86_64 (X64)
    âœ” WebView2: 133.0.3065.82
    âœ” MSVC: Visual Studio Community 2022

    âœ” rustup: 1.27.1 (54dd3d00f 2024-04-24)
    âœ” Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc (default)
    - node: 22.12.0
    - yarn: 1.22.22
    - npm: 11.0.0

[-] Packages
    - tauri ðŸ¦€: 2.3.0
    - tauri-build ðŸ¦€: 2.0.6
    - wry ðŸ¦€: 0.50.1
    - tao ðŸ¦€: 0.32.3
    - @tauri-apps/api îœ˜: 2.3.0
    - @tauri-apps/cli îœ˜: 2.3.0

[-] Plugins
    - tauri-plugin-store ðŸ¦€: 2.2.0
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-store îœ˜: 2.2.0
    - tauri-plugin-global-shortcut ðŸ¦€: 2.2.0
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-global-shortcut îœ˜: 2.2.0
    - tauri-plugin-opener ðŸ¦€: 2.2.5
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-opener îœ˜: 2.2.5
    - tauri-plugin-process ðŸ¦€: 2.2.0
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-process îœ˜: 2.2.0
    - tauri-plugin-sql ðŸ¦€: 2.2.0
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-sql îœ˜: 2.2.0
    - tauri-plugin-fs ðŸ¦€: 2.2.0
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-fs îœ˜: 2.2.0

[-] App

    - frontendDist: ../dist/just-clipboard-manager/browser
```

issue.title: [bug] Alt+Tab -ing to window won't focus its contents on Windows with `unstable` feature (can't interact with content using keyboard)

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

labels.name: scope: unstable flag
labels.description: Issue only occures with "unstable" feature flag enabled

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When you Alt + Tab to a Tauri window, or otherwise focus it without clicking on its contents, you are unable to interact with its contents without first clicking inside of it.

### Reproduction

1. Add `unstable` feature to `examples/api` app:

   https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/b0ddee8992ac3c7d47e2cfc9714f5725fadca7cf/examples/api/src-tauri/Cargo.toml#L29-L36

2. Build and start the example app.
3. Press Alt + Tab to un-focus it.
4. Press Alt + Tab to focus it again
5. Press Tab

### Expected behavior

Pressing Tab moves focus to the next HTML element.

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
[âœ”] Environment
    - OS: Windows 10.0.19045 x86_64 (X64)
    âœ” WebView2: 136.0.3240.76
    âœ” MSVC: Visual Studio Community 2022
    âœ” rustc: 1.85.1 (4eb161250 2025-03-15)
    âœ” cargo: 1.85.1 (d73d2caf9 2024-12-31)
    âœ” rustup: 1.28.1 (f9edccde0 2025-03-05)
    âœ” Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc (default)
    - node: 20.19.0
    - pnpm: 10.10.0
    - npm: 10.8.2

[-] Packages
    - tauri ðŸ¦€: 2.5.1
    - tauri-build ðŸ¦€: 2.2.0
    - wry ðŸ¦€: 0.51.2
    - tao ðŸ¦€: 0.33.0
    - @tauri-apps/api îœ˜: not installed!
    - @tauri-apps/cli îœ˜: 2.5.0

[-] Plugins
    - tauri-plugin-log ðŸ¦€: 2.4.0
    - @tauri-apps/plugin-log îœ˜: not installed!

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: font-src https://fonts.gstatic.com; style-src 'unsafe-inline' 'self' https://fonts.googleapis.com; connect-src ipc: http://ipc.localhost; img-src 'self' asset: http://asset.localhost blob: data:; default-src 'self' customprotocol: asset:
    - frontendDist: ../dist
    - devUrl: http://localhost:1420/
    - framework: Svelte
    - bundler: Vite
```

### Stack trace

```text

```

### Additional context

The bug does not appear _without_ `unstable`. The same goes for our own app.

This looks highly related to https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/9755 (fixed by https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/pull/13222).

body: The issue right now is that the window variable does not change, even though the event focus and blur event are propagating.
